title: ICE cause by tokio::spawn a async function return future opaque type

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-impl-trait
labels.description: Area: impl Trait. Universally / existentially quantified anonymous types with static dispatch.

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Polish
labels.description: Async-await issues that are part of the "polish" area

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Triaged
labels.description: Async-await issues that have been triaged during a working group meeting.

body:
The ICE cause by `cargo check`, seems happened in multiple locations. One of the cause is when calling `tokio::spawn` function. 

I don't know how to reproduce this problem in minimal example,  but the faulty code in my project comes from here
https://github.com/ShisoftResearch/bifrost/blob/f67c57209dd15072a2868f46c1d26cd356caafae/src/raft/mod.rs#L631

Expecting the code to compile or providing reason for the failure. Instead, the compile just crashed.
This problem appears on both MacOS and Linux
## Meta

rustc 1.42.0-nightly (5e8897b7b 2020-01-21)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 5e8897b7b51636f157630e6639b711d698e1d101
commit-date: 2020-01-21
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.42.0-nightly
LLVM version: 9.0

tokio 0.2.10

Backtrace:
